alert.note: Alert for Henry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 03 at 11:14PM EDT until September 04 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is likely to continue. * WHERE...Portions of EAST CENTRAL Kentucky and NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, Franklin, Henry, and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1113 PM EDT, Flooding is likely to continue in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hatton, Bryant, Flag Fork, Benson, Bagdad, Ottusville and Polsgrove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
